instruction: Reported calf soreness and dark urine after the second atovaquone-proguanil dose. Concern for myopathy due to atorvastatin.

attributes.narrative: The patient reported calf soreness and dark urine after the second dose of atovaquone-proguanil, raising concern for myopathy due to atorvastatin.

instruction: Stop atorvastatin due to potential myopathy and risk of rhabdomyolysis, especially if nirmatrelvir-ritonavir is started.

attributes.rationale: Stop atorvastatin due to potential myopathy and risk of rhabdomyolysis, especially if nirmatrelvir-ritonavir is started.

instruction: Continue taking the malaria pill (atovaquone-proguanil), double water intake to about three liters daily, and log any muscle weakness or cola-colored urine.
If pain exceeds five out of ten or urine remains brown for more than six hours, hold all suspect medications, start oral rehydration salts, and contact the river post for evacuation.

attributes.comment: If pain exceeds five out of ten or urine remains brown for more than six hours, hold all suspect medications, start oral rehydration salts, and contact the river post for evacuation.

instruction: Avoid grapefruit due to interaction with atorvastatin; stick to oranges or bottled juice.

attributes.comment: Avoid grapefruit due to interaction with atorvastatin; stick to oranges or bottled juice.

instruction: Pack albuterol in a zip bag with silica gel to prevent valve clogging. Use two puffs only if wheezing occurs. If used more than twice a week, contact the mission doctor for reassessment.

coding.display: Education about safe storage and management of medication

attributes.comment: Pack albuterol in a zip bag with silica gel to prevent valve clogging.
